meanings.definition: Moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location).
meanings.sent1: The ball went through the hoop.
meanings.sent2: The train passed through the tunnel.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to walk through the closed door.
meanings.sent4: Her words pierced through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the trees, creating a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.sent1: The project is through, and we can relax now.
meanings.sent2: After the exam, I felt relieved that it was through.
meanings.sent3: The cake was through, and everyone enjoyed it.
meanings.sent4: The book reached its through stage, ready for publishing.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner was exhausted but happy to be through with the race.

meanings.sent2: He solved the puzzle through logical reasoning.
meanings.sent3: The friends planned their trip through text messages.
meanings.sent4: They navigated through the forest using a map.
meanings.sent5: The message was conveyed through a series of gestures.

meanings.sent1: She read the book through in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: The movie kept us entertained through.
meanings.sent3: He sang the song through without missing a beat.
meanings.sent4: The journey was tough, but they persevered through.
meanings.sent5: The storm raged through the night, keeping everyone awake.

meanings.sent1: The cat darted through the door and into the garden.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed through the valley and out to the sea.
meanings.sent3: She passed through the crowd and out of sight.
meanings.sent4: The car drove through the tunnel and out into the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The bird flew through the window and back into the open sky.
